Charles Minard’s flow map of Napoleon’s March

Recreation of Charles Minard’s flow map of Napoleon’s March. This visualization depicts Napoleon’s disastrous march to Moscow, in the winter of 1812. Beginning at the Polish‐Russian border, the beige flow‐line shows the size of the Grand Army (initially 422,000) as it progressed through Russia. Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow is depicted by the black flow‐line. View Source.
